message_1: Solve and graph the inequality: x - 2 < 8.
message_2:
To solve the inequality x - 2 < 8, follow these steps:

Step 1: Add 2 to both sides of the inequality.
x - 2 + 2 < 8 + 2
x < 10

The solution to the inequality is x < 10.

To graph the inequality on a number line:

1. Draw a number line with 10 as a reference point.
2. Since x is less than 10, place an open circle at 10 (an open circle indicates that the value 10 is not included in the solution).
3. Shade the region to the left of the open circle, indicating that all values less than 10 are part of the solution.

The graph of the inequality x < 10 will have an open circle at 10 and the region to the left of the circle shaded.
